## Exercise 2


```{r}


library(pacman)

pacman::p_load(
        tidyverse,
        scales,
        ggrepel)

mammals <- c("Mole","Vampire \nbat", "Rat",
             "Opossum", "Wolf", "Baboon",
             "Australopithecus", "Male gorilla",
             "Modern human", "Porpoise",
             "Lion", "Chimpanzee", "Blue whale",
             "Elephant")

body_mass  <- c(0.03,0.03,0.3,
                2,30,20,
                40,300,
                60,100, 
                200, 50, 70000,
                9000)

brain_mass <- c(0.3,1,3,
                6,200,250,
                400,500,
                2000,2500,
                200, 300,9000,
                8000)

data <- data.frame(mammals,body_mass,brain_mass)

ggplot(data, aes(x = body_mass, y = brain_mass)) + 
geom_point(size = 2.5, color = "#0072B2", shape = 21,
           fill = "#0072B2D0") + 
scale_y_log10(breaks = c(0.01,0.1,1,10,100,1000,10000),
              labels = scales::label_comma(accuracy = 1),
               expand = c(0.01,0.1)) +
scale_x_log10(breaks = c(0.01,0.1,1,10,100,1000,10000,100000), 
              labels = scales::label_comma(accuracy = 1)) + 
geom_text_repel(
      aes(label = mammals), color = "black", size = 10/.pt,
      point.padding = 0.1, box.padding = 0.75, force = 1,
      min.segment.length = 0, seed = 7654,
      hjust = 0, vjust = 0.5) +
labs (y = "Brain mass (g)", x = "Body mass (kg)",
      title = "Relationship between brain size and body size in mammals",
      subtitle = "Larger animals with more complex evolution have larger brains") + 
theme_us + 
theme ( axis.title.y.left = element_text(hjust = 1),
        axis.title.x.bottom = element_text(hjust = 0),
        plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", 
          size = 16),
        plot.title.position = "plot",
        plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 14)) + 
coord_fixed(xlim = c(-1,100000),
            ylim = c(-1, 10000))

```
